name: Fisheries management effectiveness and opportunity
description:
The opportunity for artisanal and recreational fishing based on the quality of management of the small- scale fishing sector (Mora et al 2009).

Data sources:

- Mora, C., Myers, R.A., Coll, M., Libralato, S., Pitcher, T.J., Sumaila, R.U., Worm, B. (2009). **Management Effectiveness of the Worldï¿s Marine Fisheries**. _PLoS Biol_, 7(6), e1000131. [doi:10.1371/journal.pbio.1000131](http://dx.doi.org/10.1371/journal.pbio.1000131)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global management effectiveness scores were applied equally to all regions.

name: Purchasing power parity as a proxy for subsistence fishing need, by region
description:
The per capita purchasing power parity (PPP) adjusted gross domestic product (GDP): GDPpcPPP.

Data sources:

- The World Bank [GDP per capita, PPP (current international $)](http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global purchasing power parity information was applied equally to all regions.

name: Coastal human population as a proxy for trend in trash
description:
Coastal population, defined as the total population inland of 25 miles, extracted from Gridded Population of the World (GPW) Population Density Grid Future Estimates.

Data sources:

- Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN)/Columbia University 
- CIESIN & CIAT (Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN)/Columbia University, & Centro Internacional de Agricultura Tropical (CIAT)) (2005). **Gridded Population of the World, Version 3 (GPWv3): Population Density Grid, Future Estimates**. Palisades, NY. [NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC)](http://sedac.ciesin.columbia.edu/data/set/gpw-v3-population-density-future-estimates)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: Fertilizer consumption as a proxy for trend in nutrient pollution
description:
Statistics on fertilizer consumption from the Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO). 

Data sources:

- [FAOâs statistical database FAOSTAT](http://faostat3.fao.org/faostat-gateway/go/to/browse/R/*/E).
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: Trends in access to improved sanitation as a proxy for pathogen pollution trend
description:
Trends in percent of population with access to improved sanitation facilities.

Data sources:

- [World Health Organization and United Nations Children's Fund's Joint Monitoring Programme (WHO/UNICEF's JMP)](www.wssinfo.org/data-estimates/table)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: Pesticide consumption as a proxy for trend in chemical pollution
description:
Statistics on pesticide consumption from the Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO). 

Data sources:

- [FAOâs statistical database FAOSTAT](http://faostat3.fao.org/faostat-gateway/go/to/browse/R/*/E).
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: B/Bmsy estimates obtained using the catch-MSY method
description:
The ratio of population abundance compared to the abundance required to deliver maximum sustainable yield, obtained from the catch-MSY model (Martell & Froese, 2013).

Data sources:

- Martell, S., & Froese, R. (2013). **A simple method for estimating MSY from catch and resilience**. _Fish and Fisheries_ 14(4): 504-514. [doi:10.1111/j.1467-2979.2012.00485.x](https://dx/doi/org/10.1111/j.1467-2979.2012.00485.x)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global b_bmsy information was applied equally to all regions.

name: Catch data for each Taxon/FAO/SAUP region averaged across years (1980-2011)
description:
Mean catch-per-taxon values within each FAO major fishing area.

Data sources:

- [FAO Major Fishing Areas](http://www.fao.org/fishery/area/search/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global mean catch information was applied equally to all regions.

name: area of each saup/total OHI reporting region
description:
Lookup table of Sea Around Us Project regions to Ocean Health Index region identifiers.

Data sources:

- [Sea Around Us Project (SAUP)](http://www.seaaroundus.org)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global proportional area were applied to each region after weighting by each region's offshore area.

name: Fisheries weighting factor
description:
Proportion of wild caught fisheries yield to mariculture yield, based on FAO fisheries statistics.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-capture-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global weights were applied equally to all regions.

name: Habitat extent
description: Modeled combined habitat extent

name: Habitat health
description: Modeled combined habitat health condition trend
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global habitat health was applied equally to all regions.

name: Habitat health trend
description: Modeled combined habitat health trend
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

Coastal protected areas inland to 1km from the UN WDPA.

name: Coastal population inland 25 miles
description:
Coastal population, defined as the total population inland of 25 miles, extracted from Gridded Population of the World (GPW) Population Density Grid Future Estimates.

- Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN)/Columbia University 
- CIESIN & CIAT (Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN)/Columbia University, & Centro Internacional de Agricultura Tropical (CIAT)) (2005). **Gridded Population of the World, Version 3 (GPWv3): Population Density Grid, Future Estimates**. Lookup table for mariculture: species Latin names and species code.

Mariculture harvest from the FAO.

- [FAO global aquaculture production](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-aquaculture-production/en)

Mariculture sustainability and mariculture regulations indicated by the Mariculture Sustainability Index (MSI).

In: A comparative assessment of biodiversity, fisheries and aquaculture in 53 countriesâ Exclusive Economic Zones, Alder J, Pauly D, editors. _Fisheries Centre Research Report_, vol. 16(7) p. 28â56.

description: Mariculture years used for trend

name: Areas of observed blast (dynamite) fishing
description:
The presence of destructive artisanal blast fishing (Reefs at Risk Revisited).

- [Reefs at Risk Revisited](www.wri.org/publication/reefs-at-risk-revisited)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global scores were applied equally to each region.

name: Areas of observed poison fishing

The presence of destructive artisanal poison (cyanide) fishing (Reefs at Risk Revisited).

- [Reefs at Risk Revisited](www.wri.org/publication/reefs-at-risk-revisited)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global scores were applied equally to each region.

name: Ratio of product peak harvest value (in 2010 USD) divided by sum of all product peak harvest values, per region
description:
Ratio of harvest of of six marine products (coral, fish oil, seaweed and plants, shells, sponges, ornamental fish) from FAO.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-capture-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global weights were applied equally to each region.

name: Harvest yield of marine natural products, smoothed
description:
Yield in metric tonnes of six marine products (coral, fish oil, seaweed and plants, shells, sponges, ornamental fish) from FAO.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-capture-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global harvest (tonnes) was applied to each region after weighting by each region's offshore area to 3nm.

name: Harvest ratio to peak yeild of marine natural products
description:
Ratio to max yield (tonnes) of product peak for six marine products (coral, fish oil, seaweed and plants, shells, sponges, ornamental fish) from FAO.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-capture-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global scores were applied equally to each region.

name: Harvest value of marine natural products, smoothed
description:
Value in 2010 US dollars of six marine products (coral, fish oil, seaweed and plants, shells, sponges, ornamental fish) from FAO.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-capture-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global harvest (usd), used as a weighting score, was applied equally to all regions.

name: Harvest ratio to peak value of marine natural products
description:
Ratio to max value (2010 USD) of product peak of six marine products (coral, fish oil, seaweed and plants, shells, sponges, ornamental fish) from FAO.

Data sources:

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-capture-production/en)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global scores were applied equally to each region.

name: Ocean acidification
description:
Modeled distribution of the aragonite saturation state (AAS) of the ocean in pre-industrial (~1870) and modern times (2000-2009) (Halpern et al. 2008).

Data sources:

- Halpern, B.S., Walbridge S., Selkoe, K.A., Kappel, C.V., Micheli, F., D'Agrosa, C., Bruno, J.F., Casey, K.S., Ebert, C., Fox, H.E., Fujita, R., Heinemann, D., Lenihan, H.S., Madin, E.M.P., Perry, M.T., Selig, E.R., Spalding, M., Steneck, R., Watson, R. (2008) **A global map of human impact on marine ecosystems**. _Science_, 3199(5865): 948-952. [doi:10.1126/science.1149345](http://dx.doi.org/10.1126/science.1149345)

name: Sea level rise
description:
Modeled sea level rise (Nicholls and Cazenave 2010).

Data sources:

- Nicholls R.J. and Cazenave A. (2010). **Sea-level rise and its impact on coastal zones**. _Science_ 328: 1517-1520. [doi:10.1126/science.1185782](http://dx.doi.org/10.1126/science.1185782). 
- [AVISO Satellite Altimetry Data](http://www.aviso.oceanobs.com/en/news/ocean-indicators/mean-sea-level/processing-corrections.html)

name: Sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies
description:
Modeled sea surface temperature (Halpern et al. 2008) based on temperature anomolies provided by GHRSST and the US National Oceanographic Data Center.

Data sources:

- Halpern, B.S., Walbridge S., Selkoe, K.A., Kappel, C.V., Micheli, F., D'Agrosa, C., Bruno, J.F., Casey, K.S., Ebert, C., Fox, H.E., Fujita, R., Heinemann, D., Lenihan, H.S., Madin, E.M.P., Perry, M.T., Selig, E.R., Spalding, M., Steneck, R., Watson, R. (2008) **A global map of human impact on marine ecosystems**. _Science_, 3199(5865): 948-952. [doi:10.1126/science.1149345](http://dx.doi.org/10.1126/science.1149345)
- [AVHRR Pathfinder Version 5.0 SST data](http://pathfinder.nodc.noaa.gov) 
- Casey, K.S., Brandon, T.B., Cornillon, P., and Evans, R. (2010). **The Past, Present and Future of the AVHRR Pathfinder SST Program**, _Oceanography from Space: Revisited_, eds. V. Barale, J.F.R. Gower, and L. Alberotanza, Springer. [doi:10.1007/978-90-481-8681-5_16](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/978-90-481-8681-5_16)

name: UV radiation
description:
Modeled UV radiation (Halpern et al. 2008) based on Erythemal UV Irradiance data provided by GES DISC.

- Halpern, B.S., Walbridge S., Selkoe, K.A., Kappel, C.V., Micheli, F., D'Agrosa, C., Bruno, J.F., Casey, K.S., Ebert, C., Fox, H.E., Fujita, R., Heinemann, D., Lenihan, H.S., Madin, E.M.P., Perry, M.T., Selig, E.R., Spalding, M., Steneck, R., Watson, R. (2008) **A global map of human impact on marine ecosystems**. _Science_, 3199(5865): 948-952. [doi:10.1126/science.1149345](http://dx.doi.org/10.1126/science.1149345)
- [Goddard Earth Sciences Data and Information Services Center (GES DISC)](http://disc.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/data-holdings/PIP/erythemal_uv_irradiance.shtml)

name: High bycatch caused by artisanal fishing

The presence of destructive artisanal blast and poison (cyanide) fishing (Reefs at Risk Revisited).

- [Reefs at Risk Revisited](www.wri.org/publication/reefs-at-risk-revisited)

- [FAO fisheries statistics](http://www.fao.org/fishery/statistics/global-capture-production/en)
